file_summary: This Java class, `PetClinicIntegrationTests`, serves as a foundational integration test for the Spring PetClinic application. It utilizes Spring Boot's `@SpringBootTest` annotation to launch the entire application context on a random available port, simulating a real deployment. The primary purpose of this class is to verify the end-to-end functionality of the PetClinic application, including its data access layer and web controllers. It contains test methods that interact with the `VetRepository` to ensure data retrieval works as expected (including caching behavior) and uses a `RestTemplate` to make HTTP requests to the application's web endpoints, such as `/owners/1`, to validate that specific pages are accessible and return the expected HTTP status. Additionally, it includes a `main` method, allowing it to be run as a standalone Spring Boot application for quick manual testing or demonstration.
